page.title: 13EVERYDAY LIFE IN BELLERBY
page.content: Like most small villages in Wensleydale, the population of Bellerby consists of a mixture of people who have lived there all their lives and an increasing number of incomers who find it an attractive place in which to live. Although the village supports a shop and a post office, most people rely on the nearby market town of Leyburn for most of their shopping with perhaps frequent trips to Richmond, Darlington or Ripon when a larger variety of goods is sought. A butcher still delivers meat to the door, the travelling library visits the village fortnightly and a fish and chip van comes on Thursdays. An irregular bus service means that a car has become a necessity rather than a luxury, though many old people still have to rely on public transport.
